[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Column family: DAG_VOTE_CF_NAME] [Storage isolation] Does 'dag_vote' column family at line 45 properly isolate vote storage, or can votes leak into other schemas through key prefix collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Column family: CERTIFIED_NODE_CF_NAME] [Data recovery] Can corruption in 'certified_node' column family at line 69 cascade to other consensus data, or is it properly isolated for recovery? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [All schemas] [Database compaction] Can RocksDB compaction operations corrupt schema data by incorrectly merging/deleting entries, leading to loss of votes or certified nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [All schemas] [Backup consistency] During backup operations, can schemas be captured in inconsistent states where nodes exist without votes or certified nodes reference missing nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Schema: DagVoteSchema with NodeId key] [Epoch confusion] Can votes from epoch N be replayed in epoch N+1 by reusing NodeId keys, since the schema doesn't enforce epoch-based partitioning? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Schema: CertifiedNodeSchema] [Epoch transition] During epoch changes, can stale CertifiedNodes from previous epochs be incorrectly accepted as valid, breaking reconfiguration safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [All schemas] [State pruning] Can improper pruning of old epoch data cause dangling references where CertifiedNodes point to deleted parent nodes, corrupting the DAG structure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Schema: NodeId encoding] [Epoch overflow] Can epoch counter overflow in NodeId (line 51) after 2^64 epochs, causing key collisions between old and new epochs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [All schemas] [Validator set change] When validator set changes across epochs, can old votes from removed validators remain in DagVoteSchema and incorrectly contribute to quorum? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Schema: DagVoteSchema] [Vote replacement] Can a Byzantine validator overwrite their own vote by issuing a new vote for the same NodeId, changing their vote after seeing network state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Schema: CertifiedNodeSchema] [Forged certification] Can Byzantine nodes store self-certified nodes (with fabricated signatures) in CertifiedNodeSchema without proper verification at storage time? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Function: Node::encode_value()] [Payload manipulation] Can Byzantine validators store malicious payloads in Node objects that exploit vulnerabilities in downstream payload processing code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Schema: NodeSchema] [Timestamp manipulation] Can Byzantine validators store nodes with arbitrary timestamps that bypass time-based consensus rules when later read from storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Schema: DagVoteSchema] [Vote flooding] Can Byzantine validators flood DagVoteSchema with votes for non-existent NodeIds, exhausting storage and causing DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Function: Node::decode_value()] [Parent validation] Does Node deserialization validate that parent references (NodeCertificates) are well-formed and cryptographically valid? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [Function: CertifiedNode::decode_value()] [Signature validation] Does CertifiedNode deserialization verify aggregated signatures match the embedded node's digest, or can mismatched signatures be stored? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensusdb/schema/dag/mod.rs] [All decode functions] [Version compatibility] Can schema changes across software upgrades cause old serialized data to be misinterpreted, corrupting consensus state during rolling upgrades? (High)
